member.name: T:Physics.Units.LocalizedResourceUnitConverter
member.summary: Unit converter that allows to localize units with resources

member.name: P:Physics.Units.LocalizedResourceUnitConverter.Manager
member.summary: Resource manager to get localization strings

member.name: T:Physics.Units.BaseDerivedUnit
member.summary: Base class for any unit that can be derived by combining (multiplying) Exponent Units.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.BaseDerivedUnit.DirectScale
member.summary: Direct scale (product of all unit's scales)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.BaseDerivedUnit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: Derived unit is zero based if ALL contained units are.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.BaseDerivedUnit.IsScalable
member.summary: Derived unit is Scalable if ALL contained units are.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.DerivedUnit
member.summary: Base class for all known derived units in physics those have their own names and symbols (for an example Newton N, Pascal Pa and so on). The descendant class must be sealed and override GetSymbol, GetName, GetPlural and RecreateUnits (from those it is derived).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit
member.summary: Base class for all units in the form Factor*(Prefix*Unit)^Exponent for an example m^2, 1/ms and so on. NOTE: Prefix IS under the Exponent and Factor is NOT. and Factor can have arbitrary value (by default 1.0).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit.PowerSymbol(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs exponent form (sign of the exponent is not taken into account)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit.UnitSymbol(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs unit form (sign of the exponent is taken into account)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit.Inverse(System.Double)
member.summary: Inverse conversion (See direct conversion. We need to change the order of prefix using.)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: Exponent unit is zero based if base unit is OR exponent is 0 (no matter what is unit).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ExponentUnit.IsScalable
member.summary: Exponent unit is scalable if Underlying unit is scalable, OR exponent is 0 (no matter what is unit).

member.name: F:Physics.Units.BinaryOperationData.F1
member.summary: Conversion for the 1st operand (null value means no conversion needed).

member.name: F:Physics.Units.BinaryOperationData.F2
member.summary: Conversion for the 2nd operand. (null value means no conversion needed).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.SpecialUnit
member.summary: Just an abstraction for special branch of inheritance. All unit classes those are not in the main unit structure (Base or Derived) must be inherited from this class for automatical registration and usage. They must implement their own conversion algorithms and provide Names and Symbols.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.SpecialUnit.IsMultiplicative
member.summary: The unit can be used in multiplicative operations (product, division, power).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.SpecialUnit.IsAdditiveWith(Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: The unit is additive with another one.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.SpecialUnit.GetAdditiveConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Gets conversion functions for additive operations.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.NonlinearUnit
member.summary: Base class for all units those are converted by nonlinear law.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.NonlinearUnit.IsScalable
member.summary: Nonlinear unit IS NOT scalable (in general case).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.NonlinearUnit.IsAdditiveWith(Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Nonlinear unit IS NOT additive with other (in general case).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit
member.summary:
Logarithmic Unit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithmic_units
General formula: Y = F*log{B}(X/R) Where: Y - value in logarithmic units, X - value in units for conversion, R - reference value (in units for conversion), B - logarithm base, F - multiplication factor.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: Logarithmic unit is NOT zero based

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.IsAdditiveWith(Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Logarithmic unit is additive with another logarithmic units if their dimensions equal or one is dimensionless.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.GetAdditiveConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Gets conversion functions for additive operations with logarithmic units. RULES: If both units are dimensioned, or both are dimensionless - u2->u1 If only one dimensioned - no conversion made. If dimensioned present - result unit is that, else result unit is the first.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.GetDimension
member.summary: Logarithmic units are always Dimensionless (express relative values)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.Direct(System.Double)
member.summary: Direct conversion to some base unit. X = R*B^(Y/F)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LogarithmicUnit.Inverse(System.Double)
member.summary: Inverse conversion from some base unit. Y = F*log{B}(X/R)

member.name: T:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic
member.summary: Special class for DIMENSIONED logarithmic units - representing relation to physical value mesured in some units.

member.name: F:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic.referenceUnit
member.summary: Reference unit - the relative physical value measured with.

member.name: F:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic.referenceValue
member.summary: Reference value, calculated based on the reference unit.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic.CreateReferenceUnit
member.summary: Creates Reference Unit. Must be overriden in descendant classes. DO NOT call in descendants! Use lazy function GetReferenceUnit.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic.GetDimension
member.summary: Logarithmic unit dimension is based on Reference Unit dimension.

member.name: P:Physics.Units.DimensionedLogarithmic.ReferenceUnit
member.summary: Reference unit - the relative physical value measured with.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.NaturalUnit
member.summary: Logarithmic dimensionless unit to base e

member.name: T:Physics.Units.DecibelBase
member.summary: Base dimensionless decibel unit (decimal logarithmic unit) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decibel

member.name: T:Physics.Units.NaturalDimensioned
member.summary: Logarithmic dimensioned unit to base e

member.name: T:Physics.Units.PhysicalProperty
member.summary: The base abstract class for PhysicalProperty (?)

member.name: T:Physics.Units.BaseUnit
member.summary: Abstract class for BASE physical units. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physical_quantities Length, Time, Mass, Thermodynamic temperature, Electric current, Amount of substance, Luminous intensity.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.BaseZeroUnit
member.summary: The unit for zero offset Delta = 0.0

member.name: T:Physics.Units.DimensionlessUnit
member.summary: Base class for Dimensionless units (BASE unit is 1).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.LengthUnit
member.summary: Base class for Length units (BASE unit is meter).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.TimeUnit
member.summary: Base class for Time units (BASE unit is second).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.MassUnit
member.summary: Base class for Mass units (BASE unit is kilogram).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.TemperatureUnit
member.summary: Base class for Temperature units (BASE unit is kelvin).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.TemperatureUnit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: All temperature units are NOT zero based.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.ElectricUnit
member.summary: Base class for Electric Current units (BASE unit is ampere).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.AmountUnit
member.summary: Base class for Amount of Substance units (BASE unit is mole).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.LuminousIntensityUnit
member.summary: Base class for Luminous Intensity units (BASE unit is candela).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.InformationUnit
member.summary: Base class for Information units (BASE unit is Bit).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.PlaneAngleUnit
member.summary: Base class for Plane Angle units (BASE unit is Radian).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.SolidAngleUnit
member.summary: Base class for Solid Angle units (BASE unit is Steradian).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.Submetre
member.summary: Class to get units from Metre and Prefixes and to be able to convert with Length units.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.Subsecond
member.summary: Class to get units from Second and Prefixes and to be able to convert with Time units.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.Subgram
member.summary: Class to get units from Gram and Prefixes and to be able to convert with Mass units.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.ConstructedUnit
member.summary: A unit that can be constructed by user combining exponent units. This unit does not have its own name and symbol.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.ConstructedUnit.FindUnit(Physics.Units.ExponentUnit)
member.summary: Finds analogous Exponent unit. Exponent units are analogous if their Base units and prefixes are equal.

member.name: T:Physics.Units.UnitConverter
member.summary: The class is to implement string to physical units conversions.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.UnitConverter.CreateUnitAssembly
member.summary: Creates an assembly to register units hierarchy

member.name: T:Physics.Units.Unit
member.summary: The base abstract class for all units (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_of_measurement)

member.name: P:Physics.Units.Unit.Plural
member.summary: The plural form of the name.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.Direct(System.Double)
member.summary: Direct conversion to some base unit.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.Inverse(System.Double)
member.summary: Inverse conversion from some base unit.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.DirectScale
member.summary: Direct scale (the multiplication factor, used for 'interval' conversion from this unit scale to base)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.InverseScale
member.summary: Inverse scale (the multiplication factor, used for 'interval' conversion from base unit scale to this one)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.IsScalable
member.summary: Unit is scalable (scale factor can be used for INTREVAL conversion).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.Convertible(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Checks if units are convertible. If not - raises a EUnitsUnconvertible exception. (Units are convertible if they have compatible dimensions.)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.Convert(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts 'value' from '_from' unit to '_to' one. NOTE: use Convertible function before this method for safe conversion.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.ScaleFactor(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Calculates SCALE FACTOR (for INTERVAL conversion). NOTE: use Convertible function before this method for safe conversion.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.MakeConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates conversion delegate. Checks if conversion possible (if check is true), throws exception if not. Conversion algorithm depends on scalability of units: if not scalable - use general algorithm.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.MakeAdditiveConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Makes suitable additive conversion for specified units (checks if conversion possible, throws exception if not).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.MakeMultiplyConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Makes suitable multiplication conversion for specified units (checks if conversion possible, throws exception if not). Simplification: if dimensions equal - the first dimension squared, if both dimensionless - the first dimension used.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.MakeDivideConversion(Physics.Units.Unit,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Makes suitable divide conversion for specified units (checks if conversion possible, throws exception if not). Simplification: if dimensions equal - the result is dimensionless, if both dimensionless - the first dimension used.

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.PowerBaseOrDerived(Physics.Units.Unit,System.Int32)
member.summary: WARNING : FOR BaseUnit OR DerivedUnit ONLY!
member.param: MUST BE OF TYPE BaseUnit OR DerivedUnit

member.name: M:Physics.Units.Unit.CreateConstructed(Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Creates constructed unit by another unit. WARNING: UNIT MUST BE OF TYPE BaseUnit, DerivedUnit, ExponentUnit or ConstructedUnit.
member.returns: Constructed unit if successfull, null - if not

member.name: T:Physics.Units.LinearUnit
member.summary: Base class for all units those are converted by linear law. Direct conversion (to base unit) is Base = Delta + Value * Factor and the inverted conversion (from base to this unit) is Value = (Base - Delta) / Factor (Factor!=0).

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LinearUnit.DirectScale
member.summary: Direct scale (for ANY linear unit equals Factor)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LinearUnit.InverseScale
member.summary: Inverse scale (for ANY linear unit equals 1.0/Factor)

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LinearUnit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: Linear unit is zero based if Delta==0.0

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LinearUnit.IsScalable
member.summary: Linear unit IS scalable (INTERVAL conversion can be done using Factor value).

member.name: T:Physics.Units.LinearSubunit
member.summary: Base class to get linear units with Prefixes

member.name: M:Physics.Units.LinearSubunit.IsZeroBased
member.summary: Subunit is zero based if base unit is.

member.name: P:Physics.Units.MeasurementSystem.Item(Physics.PhysicalDimension)
member.summary: Returns the unit of a physical dimension

member.name: M:Physics.Units.MeasurementSystem.CreateStandardUnit(Physics.Dimension)
member.summary: Creates the unit of specified dimension

member.name: T:Physics.PhysicalDimension
member.summary: Basic properties such as length, mass, time and temperature that can be measured are called dimensions (http://www.che.iitb.ac.in/faculty/madhu/CL152/Handouts/Handout1.pdf). There are the following dimensions (base quantities) now (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physical_quantities http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dimensional_analysis) - Length, Time, Mass, Thermodynamic temperature, Electric current, Amount of substance, Luminous intensity. Additional three dimensions introduced Information, Plane Angle and Solid Angle to distinguish these (dimensionless) quantities from truly dimensionless.

member.name: T:Physics.ExponentDimension
member.summary: Dimension in exponential form, for an example L^2 (squared Length)

member.name: F:Physics.ExponentDimension.Base
member.summary: Base dimension (which is under the exponent)

member.name: F:Physics.Dimension.fExponents
member.summary: Physical dimension exponents (the index corresponds the order of physical dimension)

member.name: M:Physics.Dimension.VirtualOnly
member.summary: Dimension contains virtual only Physical Dimensions.

member.name: M:Physics.Dimension.Compatible(Physics.Dimension,Physics.Dimension)
member.summary: Checks, if two Dimensions are compatible for conversion. Differes from == operator by Virtual dimensions comparison. If dimensions are 'pure' virtual - they compared for strong equality, else they compared by not virtual base dimensions only.

member.name: M:Physics.Dimension.op_ExclusiveOr(Physics.Dimension,System.Int32)
member.summary: Power operator WARNING: carefully use in expressions with * operator because ^ has lower precedence than *, so ALWAYS use () for powers. To write Time multiplied by squared Length use expression: Time * (Length ^ 2) (DO NOT USE Time * Length ^ 2, because it is (Time*Length)^2)

member.name: M:Physics.Dimension.IsVirtual(Physics.PhysicalDimension)
member.summary: Checks if the physical dimension is Virtual.

member.name: M:Physics.Dimension.IsBaseDimension(Physics.Dimension)
member.summary: Defines if the dimension is base (fundamental)

member.name: T:Physics.UnitPrefix
member.summary: Base type for all unit prefixes (for an example - milli-, deci- and so on). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SI_prefix There are proposals for further harmonisation of the capitalisation. Therefore the symbols for kilo, hecto, and deca would be changed from k to K, from h to H, and from da to D.

member.name: T:Physics.Quantities.PhysicalQuantity
member.summary: Base class for any physical quantity. Defines Name, Symbol and physical dimension. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physical_quantity

member.name: M:Physics.Quantities.PhysicalQuantity.Compatible(Physics.Quantities.PhysicalQuantity,Physics.Units.Unit)
member.summary: Detects if a Qyantity is compatible with a Unit

member.name: T:Physics.Quantities.FundamentalQuantity
member.summary: Abstract class for any fundamental (base) quantity (Time, Length, Mass and so on). Descendant classes must be Sealed and override GetBaseDimension, GetName.

member.name: T:Physics.Quantities.DerivedQuantity
member.summary: Base class for any not fundamental quantity (this class is used to organize class hierarcies only(?))

member.name: M:Physics.Quantities.QuantitiesManager.GetCompatibleUnits(Physics.Quantities.PhysicalQuantity)
member.summary: Finds all compatible units (if a quantity == null - all units)

member.name: M:Physics.Quantities.LocalizedResourceQuantitiesManager.#ctor(Physics.Units.UnitConverter)
member.summary: Constructor (Unit converter Culture and Resource Manager are used to localize Quantities)
